name: Al-Arqam Islamic School
mission: TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE MUSLIM CHILDREN LIVING WITHIN THE GREATER SACRAMENTO AREA.
theoryOfChange: Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory has five Schoolwide Learning Outcomes (SLOs) conveyed through the acrostic TORCH. These SLOs are focused on establishing strong, cohesive, and engaging school programs designed to impact students academically, spiritually, socially, and physically. The revision process for these learner outcomes began in the Spring of the 2017-2018 academic year. The school's mission is to teach and nurture the 'whole' child—intellectually, spiritually, emotionally, and physically—and to instill principles of submission to the Will of Allah for personal and academic excellence. Their goals include teaching a love for Islam, practicing Islam daily, achieving first-rate academic standards, striving for excellence to compete effectively, and developing strong moral and spiritual character, self-worth, discipline, independence, ethical standards, love of learning, citizenship, and responsibility. The Islamic Education curriculum also aims for students to live Islam through submission to Allah, know Islam's history, use the Qur'an and Sunnah for decisions, take Prophet Muhammad (SAW) as a role model, and become lifelong learners by developing good study habits and being intellectual and well-rounded.

evaluationSources: Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC)

zakatClaimEvidence: The 'Donations' page of Al-Arqam Islamic School lists methods for general donations (checks, PayPal, Zelle) but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or 'zakat-eligible' funds. (Source: https://www.charitynavigator.org/ein/943311132#financials)

strengths.detail: The school directs a <cite id="2">98.1% program expense ratio</cite> toward its educational services, maximizing the impact of every dollar.
Students have access to the prestigious <cite id="3">International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program</cite> and Advanced Placement courses.
The organization maintains <cite id="1">9.1 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant resilience against economic fluctuations.

strengths_deep_dive: Al-Arqam Islamic School demonstrates a profound commitment to its educational mission through its financial structure. By maintaining a <cite id="2">98.1% program expense ratio</cite>, the institution ensures that resources are heavily concentrated on student outcomes and school operations. The academic framework is robust, integrating <cite id="3">College Preparatory Academics</cite> with specialized Islamic Studies. Furthermore, the school's financial stability is underscored by its <cite id="1">9.1 months of working capital</cite>, which allows for consistent program delivery without immediate financial pressure.
rich_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is an educational institution <cite id="3">serving the Greater Sacramento area</cite>. <cite id="1">founded in 1998</cite>, the school focuses on meeting the academic and spiritual needs of Muslim children through a comprehensive curriculum. The institution offers the <cite id="3">International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program</cite> alongside College Preparatory Academics and Islamic Studies. Financially, the organization demonstrates exceptional efficiency, reporting <cite id="2">$4,155,519 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Remarkably, the school maintains a <cite id="2">98.1% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that all funds directly support its educational mission. The school operates with strong financial health, holding <cite id="1">9.1 months of working capital</cite> in reserve.
